DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related regarding cancer therapy received prior to the diagnosis of the second primary cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Second Primary Cancer Therapy Prior Diagnosis Received
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information regarding cancer therapy received prior to the diagnosis of the second primary cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Received; taken, gotten, or acquired.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
